abstract: Mr. Langone's decision came just hours after Mr. Christie announced to the world that he would not make a bid for the White House.
snippet: Mr. Langone's decision came just hours after Mr. Christie announced to the world that he would not make a bid for the White House.
lead_paragraph: Ken Langone, the billionaire Home Depot founder who in recent weeks led an intense but unsuccessful effort to draft the New Jersey governor, Christopher J. Christie, into the presidential race, has decided he will now support Mitt Romney, the former Massachusetts governor, according to two people with knowledge of the decision.

headline.main: Leading Christie Supporter Turns to Romney
